\begin{DoxyCompactList}\small\item\em Defines an image graph where the arc weights between neighboring pixels p and q are computed as $\vert$I(p) -\/ I(q)$\vert$+1, where I(p) is the image intensity at pixel p. \end{DoxyCompactList}\item

\mbox{\hyperlink{structgft_1_1ImageGraph_1_1sImageGraph}{s\+Image\+Graph}} $\ast$ \mbox{\hyperlink{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_acfed0f2fe780c4d73e95f06b6bd5215e}{By\+Weight\+Image}} (\mbox{\hyperlink{namespacegft_aafba864394cc4eac478c28185ec4bd4d}{s\+Image32}} $\ast$W, float r)
\begin{DoxyCompactList}\small\item\em Defines an image graph where the arc weights between neighboring pixels p and q are computed as W(p) + W(q)+1, where W is an image of weights in pixel resolution. W(p) is usually calculated as the magnitude of the gradient at pixel p. \end{DoxyCompactList}\item

\begin{DoxyCompactList}\small\item\em Tests if the graph is an undirected graph. That is, it is a symmetric digraph and w(p, q) = w(q, p) for all arcs. \end{DoxyCompactList}\end{DoxyCompactItemize}


\doxysubsection{Detailed Description}
Common definitions and functions to manipulate a sparse graph of an image. 

The data structure assumes that the arcs are defined by an adjacency relation invariant to translation.

\mbox{\Hypertarget{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_acfed0f2fe780c4d73e95f06b6bd5215e}\label{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_acfed0f2fe780c4d73e95f06b6bd5215e}} 
\index{gft::ImageGraph@{gft::ImageGraph}!ByWeightImage@{ByWeightImage}}
\index{ByWeightImage@{ByWeightImage}!gft::ImageGraph@{gft::ImageGraph}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{ByWeightImage()}{ByWeightImage()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \mbox{\hyperlink{structgft_1_1ImageGraph_1_1sImageGraph}{s\+Image\+Graph}} $\ast$ gft\+::\+Image\+Graph\+::\+By\+Weight\+Image (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{namespacegft_aafba864394cc4eac478c28185ec4bd4d}{s\+Image32}} $\ast$}]{W,  }\item[{float}]{r }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}



Defines an image graph where the arc weights between neighboring pixels p and q are computed as W(p) + W(q)+1, where W is an image of weights in pixel resolution. W(p) is usually calculated as the magnitude of the gradient at pixel p. 

\mbox{\Hypertarget{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_a61b695f66c46fe520051b55fe276c2de}\label{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_a61b695f66c46fe520051b55fe276c2de}} 
\index{gft::ImageGraph@{gft::ImageGraph}!ChangeType@{ChangeType}}
\index{ChangeType@{ChangeType}!gft::ImageGraph@{gft::ImageGraph}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{ChangeType()}{ChangeType()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily void gft\+::\+Image\+Graph\+::\+Change\+Type (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{structgft_1_1ImageGraph_1_1sImageGraph}{s\+Image\+Graph}} $\ast$}]{sg,  }\item[{int}]{type }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}



Changes the type of arc weights to D\+I\+S\+S\+I\+M\+I\+L\+A\+R\+I\+TY or C\+A\+P\+A\+C\+I\+TY. By changing the type, the arc weights are complemented/inverted. 

The arc weights may represent a D\+I\+S\+S\+I\+M\+I\+L\+A\+R\+I\+TY or a C\+A\+P\+A\+C\+I\+TY between neighboring pixels, as generally used by the path-\/cost functions of Image Foresting Transform or by the min-\/cut/max-\/flow algorithm, respectively. \mbox{\Hypertarget{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_a8a0e31932f3773278a9905417a89ac19}\label{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_a8a0e31932f3773278a9905417a89ac19}}

Replaces a given arc weight with a new value.

\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{IsUndirectedGraph()}{IsUndirectedGraph()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \mbox{\hyperlink{namespacegft_af01201e71d26f078d5eb9a4e41a6ffe2}{bool}} gft\+::\+Image\+Graph\+::\+Is\+Undirected\+Graph (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{structgft_1_1ImageGraph_1_1sImageGraph}{s\+Image\+Graph}} $\ast$}]{sg }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}



Tests if the graph is an undirected graph. That is, it is a symmetric digraph and w(p, q) = w(q, p) for all arcs. 

\mbox{\Hypertarget{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_a05535624cc75b912af77765f7ff3bd24}\label{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_a05535624cc75b912af77765f7ff3bd24}}

Computes the Khalimsky grid of a saliency map. 

A saliency map can be visualized through Khalimsky grids, only when its image graph is given by the 4-\/adjacency relation. \mbox{\Hypertarget{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_a424d99ba77770e61253b7aa19c1c611e}\label{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_a424d99ba77770e61253b7aa19c1c611e}}

\mbox{\Hypertarget{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_a6138debf38e5d19968f6b2c2072ee7ac}\label{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_a6138debf38e5d19968f6b2c2072ee7ac}} 
\index{gft::ImageGraph@{gft::ImageGraph}!Transpose@{Transpose}}
\index{Transpose@{Transpose}!gft::ImageGraph@{gft::ImageGraph}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{Transpose()}{Transpose()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily void gft\+::\+Image\+Graph\+::\+Transpose (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{structgft_1_1ImageGraph_1_1sImageGraph}{s\+Image\+Graph}} $\ast$}]{sg }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}



Computes the transpose of a directed graph. 

Transpose of a directed graph G is another directed graph on the same set of vertices with all of the arcs reversed compared to the orientation of the corresponding arcs in G. That is, if G contains an arc (u, v) with weight w(u, v)=k then its transpose G\textquotesingle{} contains an arc (v, u) with weight w\textquotesingle{}(v, u)=k and vice versa. \mbox{\Hypertarget{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_ae1363f2f1067f8a9ec8518760d15c760}\label{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_ae1363f2f1067f8a9ec8518760d15c760}} 
\index{gft::ImageGraph@{gft::ImageGraph}!WeightedMean@{WeightedMean}}
\index{WeightedMean@{WeightedMean}!gft::ImageGraph@{gft::ImageGraph}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{WeightedMean()}{WeightedMean()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \mbox{\hyperlink{structgft_1_1ImageGraph_1_1sImageGraph}{s\+Image\+Graph}} $\ast$ gft\+::\+Image\+Graph\+::\+Weighted\+Mean (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{structgft_1_1ImageGraph_1_1sImageGraph}{s\+Image\+Graph}} $\ast$}]{G1,  }\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{structgft_1_1ImageGraph_1_1sImageGraph}{s\+Image\+Graph}} $\ast$}]{G2,  }\item[{float}]{w2 }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}



Computes the weighted arithmetic mean of the corresponding arcs of two graphs. 

\mbox{\Hypertarget{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_aaba10d1ded119f5c4f5468fb1795097b}\label{namespacegft_1_1ImageGraph_aaba10d1ded119f5c4f5468fb1795097b}}
